bug.author: wtstephe
bug.summary: [Bug] Issue with double and spectral mixture kernel
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When initializing a spectral mixture kernel using initialize_from_data() with data of type torch.DoubleTensor, the initialization crashes. I think the problem is the line in spectral_mixture_kernel.py, which always creates a tensor of type torch.FloatTensor: min_dist = torch.zeros(1, self.ard_num_dims) The following fixed this for me: min_dist = torch.zeros(1, self.ard_num_dims).type(train_x.type()) <denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
import torch import gpytorch
X = torch.sin(torch.linspace(0,1)).double() Y = torch.sin(torch.linspace(0,1)).double() + 4.5
covar_module = gpytorch.kernels.SpectralMixtureKernel(num_mixtures=10) covar_module.double() covar_module.initialize_from_data(X, Y) Error message: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "breakSpectralMixtureKernel.py", line 9, in <module> covar_module.initialize_from_data(X, Y) File "/home/will/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gpytorch-0.3.3-py3.6.egg/gpytorch/kernels/spectral_mixture_kernel.py", line 163, in initialize_from_data RuntimeError: output with backend CPU and dtype Float doesn't match the desired backend CPU and dtype Double </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Thanks for the issue and reproducible code! I see that you are still using gpytorch 0.3.3. You should update your package version since this bug was fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch/issues/737>#737</denchmark-link>
